Abstract â€“ The Physical Markup Language (PML) is
intended to be a common "language" for describing
physical objects, processes and environments. Much
as the Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) has
standardized the way in which information is
presented on the Internet, PML is designed to
standardize descriptions of physical objects for use by
both humans and machines. The primary objective of
PML is to serve as a common base for software
applications, data storage and analytic tools for
industry and commerce. This paper presents some
fundamental issues in the design of the language, as
well as assumptions underlying its development and
implementation.
